member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.WebChartHelper.UltraWebChartDesigner
member.summary: This class will do the standard designer for a component but also allow filtering of properties and attributes in the design window to dynamically update what the user can For UltraChart, we will hide those chart specific properties that do not apply to the chart type the user has selected Make sure to call TypeDescriptor.Refresh(component) from your component in order to clear the cache and requery these filters This member supports the charting internal infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.WebChartHelper.UltraWebChartDesigner.PostFilterProperties(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: This member supports charting framework. Not to be used explictly in the code.

member.summary: Delta View State for UltraChart

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.WebChartHelper.UltraWebChartDVS.#ctor

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Exceptions.ImageStoreException
member.summary: Thrown when a file path passed into a method is not valid. This usually means that the path is not found or access has been denied.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Exceptions.ImageStoreException.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a ImageStoreException with default properties.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Exceptions.ImageStoreException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a ImageStoreException with the specified exception message.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Exceptions.ImageStoreException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Creates a ImageStoreException with the specified exception message, and inner exception.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.SecureImagePipe
member.summary: Image server control to server the images to UltraWebChart

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.SecureImagePipe.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of secure image pipe for delivering chart images on web.

remarks.p: Because charts in your web application may contain sensitive or confidential data, UltraWebChart provides a secure channel for chart images via the SecureImagePipe. The SecureImagePipe establishes connection between the server and the browser that is used to transmit all chart image data. The SecureImagePipe property provides access to the settings of the secure image pipe, such as the format that will be used to stream the image and whether the browser will cache images locally.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.SecureImagePipe.Render(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Renders the chart image and streams it to the browser using the HTTP connection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.SecureImagePipe.ResetSerializeImageType
member.summary: Resets SerializeImageType to its default setting.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.SecureImagePipe.ShouldSerializePragmaNoCache
member.summary: Indicates whether the PragmaNoCache property should be persisted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.SecureImagePipe.ImageType
member.summary: Specifies the image file format used to stream the chart.
member.remarks: Available image formats include the compressed formats GIF, JPEG and PNG and the uncompressed formats BMP and TIFF.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.SecureImagePipe.PragmaNoCache
member.summary: Cache setting of chart image in the browser.

remarks.p: "PragmaNoCache" is an element of the HTTP header that specifies that the browser should not cache the image locally, but re-fetch it from the server whenever the page is refreshed. If your chart is updated frequently, you should set this property to True to ensure that the browser is always displaying the latest version of the chart. You should also set this property to True if your application automatically forces page refreshes on the browser.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.SecureImagePipe.ID
member.summary: Returns the unique ID of the SecureImagePipe.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.SecureImagePipe.EnableViewState
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the server control persists its view state, and the view state of any child controls it contains, to the requesting client.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.LocalizedCategoryAttribute.GetLocalizedString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the localized category name
member.param: Name of the category to retreive

member.summary: OnInit is called upon initialization of the component after an instance is created.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.LoadViewState(System.Object)
member.summary: This method is overridden to implement the saving of view state in Ultrachart

member.summary: This is overridden to implement the view state in the UltraChart.
member.returns: Returns the view state of the control.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.PrintChart
member.summary: Prints the chart to the default printer using the default page settings.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.PrintChart(System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings,System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings)
member.summary: Prints the chart to the specified printer using the specified page settings.

remarks.p: The PageSettings object is used to specify the attributes of the print job, such as page size, orientation, margins, etc.

member.param: The PrinterSettings object that names the printer. If no value is supplied, the default printer will be used
The PageSettings object that specifies how the print job will formatted. If no value is supplied, the default page settings will be used.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.ShouldSerializeJavaScriptFileName
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value that determines whether the property is set to its default value.

remarks.p: Returns True if the JavaScriptFileName property is not set to its default value; otherwise, it returns False.
Invoke the method to reset this property to its default value.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.ResetJavaScriptFileName
member.summary: Resets the property to its default value.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to reset the JavaScriptFileName property to its default value.
Once this method is invoked, the method will return False until the JavaScriptFileName property is set again.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.SaveTo(System.String,System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat)

remarks.p: This method saves the current chart image to a local file on the server. When the file is saved, the property returns the URL of the image file.

member.param: The full path and filename of the image that is being saved.
The file format of the image, specified using ImageType.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.SaveTo(System.IO.Stream,System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat)
member.summary: Saves the current chart image to a stream using the specified image format.

remarks.p: This method saves the current chart image to a stream. The stream is kept open and it is up to application calling this method to close it.

member.param: The stream being used to save the image.
The file format of the image, specified using ImageType.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.IsDesignMode
member.summary: Returns true if the component is in designer mode.
member.returns: boolean, true or false, depending upon if component is in design mode.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.DataValidity(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: sets whether the data is valid or not. NOT to be used by end user
member.returns: NOT to be used by the end user

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.RaisePostBackEvent(System.String)
member.summary: This method handles the occurrence of post-back events on the server.

remarks.p: This method is invoked in the component when an event occurs which requires data to be posted back to the server from the client. Typically, such events will require a page refresh on the browser to display any updated information.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.ShouldSerializeScrollBarImage
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value that determines whether the property is set to its default value.

remarks.p: Returns True if the ScrollBarImage property is not set to its default value; otherwise, it returns False.
Invoke the method to reset this property to its default value.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.ResetScrollBarImage
member.summary: Resets the property to its default value.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to reset the ColorModel property to its default value.
Once this method is invoked, the method will return False until the ScrollBarImage property is set again.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.ChartImagesPath
member.summary: Name of the JavaScript file that provides helper functions for the control.
member.remarks: This property specifies the URL to the JavaScript file that is needed for normal operation of UltraWebChart. The JavaScript file contains all of the code for client- and server-side event handling, along with tooltip and ActiveImages code.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.EnableScrollBar
member.summary: Enable/Disable scroll bar on the web chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.JavaScriptFileName
member.summary: Name of the JavaScript file that provides helper functions for the control.
member.remarks: This property specifies the URL to the JavaScript file that is needed for normal operation of UltraWebChart. The JavaScript file contains all of the code for client- and server-side event handling, along with tooltip and ActiveImages code.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.ImageUrl
member.summary: The URL of a chart image saved on the server using the SaveTo method.

remarks.p: This property is used in conjunction with the method.

When a chart is saved to a file on the server, this property returns the URL that maps to the location of the chart in the server's file system. The developer should make sure that URL specified by this property is publicly visible on the server.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.ClientSideEvents
member.summary: Configures client-side event handling.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.ImagePipePageName
member.summary: The name of the web form designated as the secure image pipe.

remarks.p: Name of WebForm in the project which contains the "SecureImagePipe" component. This page is used to stream the chart image data securely from the server to the browser.
For more information, see .

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.Width
member.summary: The width of chart in pixels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.Height
member.summary: The height of the chart in pixels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.LabelHash
member.summary: Sets or gets the hash table for the chart's custom labels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.ChartType
member.summary: Specifies which type of chart will be rendered. This affects the set of visible properties in the Designer.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.ColumnLineChart
member.summary: Returns an Appearance object that you can use to access all the formatting properties of an ColumnLine Chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.ScatterLineChart
member.summary: Returns an Appearance object that you can use to access all the formatting properties of an ScatterLine Chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.Transform3D
member.summary: Changes the perspective used when displaying a 3-D chart.

remarks.p: 3-D charts can be rotated around their X and Y axes, as well as scaled (moved along the Z axis). The Transform3D property gives you the ability to manipulate the orientation and scaling of the chart to achieve the best perspective on the 3-D data being displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.Border
member.summary: The set of all appearance-related properties that apply to the border, including color, draw style, and thickness.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.Legend
member.summary: Returns an Appearance object that you can use to access all the formatting properties of the chart's legend.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.Drill
member.summary: Appearance of the hierarchical Drill Down chart behavior.

remarks.p: This property exposes the to the UltraWebChart control, allowing the developer to set properties related to UltraWebChart's drill down behavior at run-time (defining drill down hierarchies in the design-time environment is unsupported.)

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.Data
member.summary: Returns a DataAppearance object that can be used to configure the data connection of the chart to the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.EmptyChartText
member.summary: Text to be shown to user until the chart data is available.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.TitleTop
member.summary: Returns an Appearance object that you can use to access all the formatting properties of title box at the top of the chart.

member.summary: Returns an Appearance object that you can use to access all the formatting properties of title box at the left edge of the chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.BackColor
member.summary: Sets the background color for the entire chart control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.CrossHairColor
member.summary: Gets or Set the color of the cross hair.
member.remarks: The cross-hair cursor provides a greater degree of accuracy to assist users when clicking on active segments of the chart, such as individual data points.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.EnableCrossHair
member.summary: Displays a cross-hair cursor when the mouse passes over the control at run-time.
member.remarks: The cross-hair cursor provides a greater degree of accuracy to assist users when clicking on active segments of the chart, such as individual data points.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.BackgroundImageFileName
member.summary: Sets the background image for the control's background.

remarks.p: Specify the full path and filename of a valid image file that will be displayed in the chart's background. The selected image will be scaled to the dimemsions of the chart (the default setting) or tiled to fill the available space, depending on the value of .

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.BackgroundImageStyle
member.summary: Determines whether the background image displayed in the cart is stretched or tiled to fill the available area of the chart.

remarks.p: Use the property to specify the image that will be displayed in the chart's background.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.Tooltips
member.summary: Returns an object that you can use to access all the formatting properties of the chart's tooltips, including such behavioral settings as highlighting and mouse events.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.CandleChart
member.summary: Returns an Appearance object that you can use to access all the formatting properties of a Candle Chart.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.ChartDataClicked
member.summary: Event handler for UltraChart mouse click events.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.Primitives
member.summary: Gets Primitives for manipulating individual chart elements.

remarks.p: Developers can use this property to retrieve an IProvidePrimitives implementation for accessing individual graphical elements in the Scene by their row and column indexes.

Primitives may be managed differently depending on whether an UltraWebChart has scrolling and/or scaling (zoom) enabled, therefore developers should not expect a reference to the IPrimitiveProvider to remain valid if an UltraWebChart control's scrolling and/or scaling state is changed at run-time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.UltraChart.About
member.summary: Displays the About information for the UltraWebChart control.

member.summary: Scrollbar skin image.

member.summary: Resets the ClientOnChartScroll property to its default value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.WebEventAppearance.ClientOnMouseOver
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called when the mouse cursor moves over charted data.

remarks.p: The name of the JavaScript function can be user defined or native. For example, to specify that the native function alert should be called, this property could be set to "alert('hello')." To specify that a user-defined function, myFunction, should be called, this property would be set to "myFunction."
A user-defined function must be defined either inline or in a linked JavaScript (.JS) file and can accept the following parameters:

dd.p: Integer. The number of the row that contains the data that was clicked.
Integer. The number of the column that contains the data that was clicked.
Double. The value of the data that was clicked.
String. The label of the row that contains the data that was clicked.
String. The label of the column that contains the data that was clicked.
String. The name of the event that occurred. One of "MOUSE_OVER," "MOUSE_OUT," or "MOUSE_CLICKED."

remarks.p: For more information about using this property, please see Using Client-Side Events.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.WebEventAppearance.ClientOnMouseOut

A user-defined function must be defined either inline or in a linked JavaScript (.JS) file and can accept the following parameters:

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebChart.WebEventAppearance.ClientOnMouseClick
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called when charted data is clicked.

remarks.p: The name of the JavaScript function can be user defined or native. For example, to specify that the native function alert should be called, this property could be set to "alert('hello')." To specify that a user-defined function, myFunction, should be called, this property would be set to "myFunction."
A user-defined function must be defined either inline or in a linked JavaScript (.JS) file and can accept the following parameters:

dd.p: Integer. The number of the row that contains the data that was clicked.
Integer. The number of the column that contains the data that was clicked.
Double. The value of the data that was clicked.
String. The label of the row that contains the data that was clicked.
String. The label of the column that contains the data that was clicked.
String. The name of the event that occurred. One of "MOUSE_OVER," "MOUSE_OUT," or "MOUSE_CLICKED."

remarks.p: For more information about using this property, please see Using Client-Side Events.
